questions.prologue: 40 years old male with fascial deformity. Bone scan shows uptake in right 2nd and 4th ribs.

questions.prologue: A patient presented with left sided proptosis. A CT reveals low density mass causing expansion of the frontal sinus. There is focal thinning of the bony walls, dehiscence of the orbital roof and mass effect on the globe. There is no enhancement with IV contrast medium.
questions.main: What is the most likely diagnosis?

answers.body: Usually involves no more than 2 vertebral bodies.
Mild destruction or spared intervertebral disc.
Low signal in DWI, bright signal in ADC
Low signal in DWI, low signal in ADC
Bright signal in DWI, bright signal in ADC
Bright signal in DWI, low signal in ADC
Obliteration of the fat pads in the pre-antral region and pterygopalatine fossa.
Enlargement and erosion of the infraortibal fissure, infraorbital and round foramina.
Thickening and enhancement of maxillary nerve in the round foramen.
Fatty changes of denervated masseter muscle.

qImgs.comment: Further MRI shows non enhancing mass showing homogenous low T1, bright T2 signal intensity.
